content:
Yes, other countries with active volcanoes often look towards Iceland as a model for preparedness and management. Iceland is recognized as one of the world's leading countries in the field of volcano monitoring and research, and their strategies for managing volcanic activities have been closely studied and followed by other countries with similar hazards.

For instance, when Indonesia experienced a devastating tsunami in 2004, Iceland provided the country with GPS equipment and helped train local scientists in monitoring techniques. Iceland also offers training programs for international scientists and emergency response professionals and collaborates with partners around the world to share the latest research on volcanic activity, early warning systems, and emergency response strategies.

Overall, Iceland's expertise in volcanic monitoring and management has become an essential resource for other countries facing similar natural hazards, and Iceland has established itself as a global leader in the field of volcano research and management.
